frameDefinitions: An Agent begins preventing a Captive from moving despite a tendency or desire on the part of the Captive to do so.
In this frame an Agent continues to possess a Theme for a Duration of time. ''
A Protagonist is awake at some Time and Place.
An Executioner punishes an individual (Executed) with death as a consequence of some action of the Evaluee (the Reason).
This frame describes a Theme losing its autonomy and perhaps sustaining material damage as the result of a successful invasion on the behalf of a Conqueror.
A Winner has victory over an Loser.
frameExamples: Authorities recently <t>captured</t> several suspects who were hiding in a remote mountain area.
In her heart she must <t>retain</t> bitterness against those who had killed him.
The Spaniards <t>conquered</t> the Incas with both the Cross and the arquebus
listRoleDefinitions: The entity which is captured.
The <fen>Agent</fen> brings the <fen>Captive</fen> into custody.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-sentient entity which is responsible for restricting the movement or location of the <fen>Captive</fen>.
When the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
The person who has possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The entity which the <fen>Agent</fen> possesses for a <fen>Duration</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> has possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> keeps the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The entity that is not sleeping.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is awake.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Executioner</fen> is the individual who performs the execution.
The <fen>Executed</fen> is the person who is killed by the <fen>Executioner</fen> in retribution for the crime that the <fen>Executed</fen> was convicted of.
When the execution occurs.
Where the execution takes place.
The <fen>Conqueror</fen> is the entity that overtakes the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the land, government, and its people that is seized by the <fen>Conqueror</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Conqueror</fen> seizes the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Conqueror</fen> takes over the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The individual or individuals who beat the <fen>Loser</fen>.
The individual or individuals that get beat by the <fen>Winner</fen>.
When the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory over the <fen>Loser</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory <fen>Loser</fen>.
listRoleExamples: Police have captured <fex>three of the suspected bombers</fex> after a week-long search.
<fex>Authorities</fex> recently captured several suspects who were hiding in a remote mountain area.
Authorities secured the target <fex>in a private residence</fex>.
At all times <fex>the Saxon government</fex> held on to its insistently practiced political tradition.
Once you've got a War Bond, hang on to <fex>it</fex> for the full ten years of its life.
Margerite held on to the key <fex>on Wednesday</fex> until I returned to pick it up.
He will retain <fex>in his heart</fex> the memory of the vast Holocaust.
<fex>She</fex> was awake through the whole football game.
The truth is, <fex>we</fex> have all put them to death.
<fex>He</fex> was to be hanged in the morning.
<fex>The Achaemenid monarch Cambyses</fex> conquered Egypt in the year 525 BC
Britain had an opportunity to conquer <fex>Europe</fex>.
China 's <fex>1997</fex> takeover would push over 10 per cent of the population out of the colony
<fex>On Planet Earth</fex>, humans prefer to conquer those lands whose acquistion offers some economic benefit or advantage.
